bill_title: revise the membership of certain local boards of equalization.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the membership of certain local boards of equalization. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-11-13 be amended to read as follows: 10-11-13. The board of supervisors of each township and the governing body of each incorporated municipality, together with a member of the school board or school boards whose district comprises all or a part of the township or municipality, local board of equalization for each township consists of the board of supervisors of each township. The local board of equalization for each school district consists of one member of the governing body of each municipality within the school district, together with four members of the school board. The local boards of equalization shall meet on the third Monday of March for the purpose of equalizing the assessment of property in each township or municipality. The meeting shall be held at the office of the municipal clerk or finance officer, the office of the township clerk, or the location established pursuant to § 8-3-1 by the township board. school district. The local board of equalization for the township shall meet at the office of the clerk or finance officer of the township. The local board of equalization for the school district shall meet at the school district office. The equalization board shall immediately ascertain whether all taxable property in the respective township or municipality school district has been properly placed upon the assessment roll and has been duly valued by the director of equalization.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the membership of certain local boards of equalization. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 10-11-13 be amended to read as follows: 10-11-13. The board of supervisors of each township and the governing body of each incorporated municipality, together with a member of the school board or school boards whose district comprises all or a part of the township or municipality, local board of equalization for each township consists of the board of supervisors of each township. The local board of equalization for each school district consists of two members of the governing body of each municipality within the school district, together with three members of the school board. The local boards of equalization shall meet on the third Monday of March for the purpose of equalizing the assessment of property in each township or municipality. The meeting shall be held at the office of the municipal clerk or finance officer, the office of the township clerk, or school district. The local board of equalization for the township shall meet at the office of the township clerk or the location established pursuant to § 8-3-1 by the township board. The local board of equalization for the school district shall meet at the school district office. The equalization board shall immediately ascertain whether all taxable property in the respective township or municipality school district has been properly placed upon the assessment roll and has been duly valued by the director of equalization.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
